newsitem.title: ETHIOPIA: Ethiopian premier rules out war with Sudan.
newsitem.headline: Ethiopian premier rules out war with Sudan.

text.p: Ethiopian Prime Minister Meles Zenawi ruled out the possibility of war with neighbouring Sudan despite charges of aggression from Khartoum's Islamist-backed government, the national news agency said on Friday.
The agency said Meles told parliament on Thursday that Sudan and Ethiopia would not go to war "in spite of the massive military propaganda from the other side".

Sudan has accused Ethiopia, along with Eritrea and Uganda, of direct military involvement in a rebel offensive launched a month ago from the south and east by the Sudan People's Liberation Army and allied opposition forces.
"Ethiopians have had more than their fair share of war, bloodletting and sufferings and its earnest desire now is for the prevalence of peace between the two neighbouring countries," Meles said.
He added that Sudan was incapable of military confrontation with Ethiopia.

Relations between the two neighbours have been chilly since Addis Ababa accused Khartoum of harbouring gunmen who attempted to assassinate Egypt's President Hosni Mubarak in the Ethiopian capital in 1995.
